intro: Cirsium × alpestre, commonly known as the alpine thistle, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flower heads that bloom in late summer. This plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Cirsium × alpestre is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and Asia. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
